ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Then reduces them to rusty rubbish.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and then made it into a blackish straw.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: then caused it to wither away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Then made it dry and dark.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And then makes it dark stubble.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then makes it dried up, dust-colored.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: then made it a blackening wrack.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Then turneth it to russet stubble.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: then turns it into black stubble.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then maketh it to stubble dusky.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and then turned it into a black scum.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And then doth make it (but) swarthy stubble.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And then makes it dark stubble.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: then made it dry dark, flaky stubble,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And then turns it into light debris.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [87:5] then made it, after verdancy, blackened stubble, desiccated broken chaff.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 748 (Then turneth it) after being green (to russet stubble) i.e. He makes it dry and black when it exceeds a year.
